title: Bamboo Gains
question_text:
The average daily growth of unfertilized bamboo in peek growing season is $\mu_o=11 \text{ cm}$ with standard deviation $\sigma_o=1.3 \text{ cm}$. The average daily growth of fertilized bamboo in peek growing season is $\mu_f=12.9 \text{ cm}$ with standard deviation $\sigma_f=0.9 \text{ cm}$.
A random sample of $90$ unfertilized and $100$ fertilized bamboo plants are tracked during peak growing season and the difference in their sample's average growth is analyzed.
The difference in sample mean growth is found to be $\bar{x}_f-\bar{x}_o=1.5 \text{ cm}$.
Interpret the likelihood of a difference in sample mean as little as $1.5 \text{ cm}$.
